title: Why Best Fit Line Does Not Pass Origin

content.question: A person exerts a continually increasing force on an object in a constant direction. A graph of the acceleration of the object as a function of the applied force is shown above. Which of the following best explains why a best-fit line would not pass through the origin?

choices.label: An additional force is exerted on the object in the same direction as the applied force.
An additional force is exerted on the object in the direction opposite the applied force.
The object was moving at constant speed before the force was applied.

Data was not collected for applied forces less than <math alttext="20 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: An additional force is exerted on the object in the direction opposite the applied force.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
